Hector has always been known for being very hard-working and for always seeking to move forward, together with his family. These qualities have  allowed him to overcome great adversity that has arisen in his life.  

With the aim of seeing his business continue to grow, Hector is seeking a loan that will offer him the chance to purchase a dairy cow. This will enable him to increase his production capacity and meet market demand.

Hector hopes that this way his monthly income will increase considerably, as he will be able to fill customer orders that before, because of limited capacity, he had to reject. As well, Hector hopes that with greater income, his family can enjoy a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities so that they can progress.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, so that he can increase his production capacity and meet market demand.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Memunatu from Grassfield (eastern area) in Freetown. She is divorced from her husband, because she cannot give him a male child.  Memunatu has two children between the ages of eleven and fourteen. Her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Memunatu established her general merchandise business. 

She began her business, because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family, after divorcing from her husband. Her business is the only source of income she has, and she works there six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are shortages of goods and price fluctuations.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to buy more food commodities such as bags of rice, salt, Maggi cubes, biscuits and mayonnaise. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her daughters up to the university level. In the future, Memunatu plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food commodities such as bags of rice, salt, Maggi cubes and biscuits.

loans.name: Jhonny Alberto

texts.es:
Jhonny es un joven emprendedor que desde muy corta edad ha aprovechado el conocimiento de sus padres para empezar a trabajar, generar sus propios ingresos y montar su propio negocio. Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, este joven de 21 años aprendió la actividad del cultivo de verduras, y desde entonces ha venido ejerciendo esta actividad con una gran capacidad para trabajar. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos decidió montar su propio negocio y actualmente cultiva y comercializa sus productos a parte del cultivo de sus padres. La gran dificultad que presenta Jhonny es la falta de capital para poder comprar los insumos que requiere en su cultivo y sacarlo adelante. Es por esto que Jhonny busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, riegos, fungicidas e insecticidas con los cuales pueda sacar su cultivo adelante.

Jhonny espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando los ingresos con los cuales pueda prosperar por su propia cuenta y en un futuro pueda ofrecer a sus padres la oportunidad de descansar y no seguir trabajando arduas jornadas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a young entrepreneur who, from an early age, has used his parents' knowledge to start working in order to generate his own income and start his own business. For the past five years, this 21-year-old learned to grow vegetables and since then has been practicing his skills with a great capacity for work. Thanks to the high quality of his products, he decided to start his own business and now grows and sells his products as part of his parents' crops.

The biggest difficulty Jhonny has is a lack of capital to be able to buy materials necessary to move his business forward. It is for this reason that Jhonny is seeking a loan to bring him opportunity to access fertilizers, irrigation, fungicides, and insecticides with which to improve his growing. Jhonny hopes that he can continue generating income with which to prosper on his own and in the future be able to offer his parents the opportunity to rest and not have to work long and hard hours.

loans.use: Compra de abonos, riegos, fungicidas e insecticidas con los cuales pueda sacar su cultivo adelante.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano, de 35 años de edad casado con virginia de 30 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la asociación vista alegre del distrito de Sivia. Emiliano consecuente con sus objetivos, él se dedica al cultivo de café y cacao en su parcela agrícola ubicado en la comunidad de chuvivana  desde hace 11 años, mientras que su querida esposa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Emiliano trabaja sembrando cacao, para ello necesita la ayuda de 2 peones permanentes que siempre trabajan para él. Actualmente cuenta ya con 6 hectáreas de cacao del que gracias a su dedicación, su cosecha anual da un promedio de 2,500 Kg., de cacao, cantidad del cual se siente orgulloso, y asimismo entusiasmado en seguir incrementando más plantas de cacao.  Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el que él se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cotas. Él esta alegre por tener un banco comunal bien unido.
Con los 3, 500 nuevos soles incrementará más cultivos de cacao, para ello comprará más plantas y contratará peones.
texts.en:
Emiliano, 35, is married to Virginia, 30, and they have four children from this relationship.  They live together in their own house located in the Vista Alegre neighborhood of the district of Sivia.  Emiliano, according to his goals, has worked for 11 years growing coffee and cacao on his plot of farmland located in the community of Chuvivana, while his beloved wife works selling groceries.

Emiliano works growing cacao, for which he needs the help of two permanent farmworkers who always work for him.  Currently he already has six hectares of cacao of which, thanks to his dedication, his annual harvest gives an average of 2,500 kg. of cacao.  He always feels proud of this quantity and excited about continuing to increase his cacao plants more.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he promises to make his payments punctually.  He is happy about having a very close communal bank.

With the 3,500 nuevos soles (PEN) he will increase his cacao plants, for which he will buy more plants and hire farmworkers.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers and to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Luchando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: Doña Reina es miembro del Grupo Solidario Luchando por el Futuro, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos los cuales son estudiantes, es casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio. Hace algunos años doña Reina inicio con una pulpería pero dejo ese negocio para dedicarse a la venta de ropa y calzado y desde hace seis años se dedica a este rubro, trabaja en conjunto con su esposo y sus hijos,  son una familia muy unida y luchadora. Una de sus ventajas es que el negocio tiene muy buena ubicacion y tiene mucha clientela, su horario de atención es de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm. El préstamo que doña Reina solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de ropa y calzado con estilos nuevos y que estén a la moda para poder llamar la atención de sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas para obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden al sustento de su familia. Una de sus metas es tener un local más amplio para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Con los prestamos que ha obtenido doña Reina su negocio a progresado mucho y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado. Doña Reina ha tenido seis créditos con FAMA y ha cancelado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Reina is a member of the lending group "Luchando por el Futuro" [Fighting for the Future]. She is 53 and a mother of 4 children who are in school. Her husband works in agriculture and commerce. Some years ago Reina started a small grocery store but she left that business in order to focus on clothing and shoe sales, which she has been doing for six years. She works together with her husband and kids - they are a very united and hardworking family. One of the advantages of her business is good location and a good clientele base. She is open from 7am to 7pm.

Reina asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing and footwear in new, fashionable styles so that she can draw in her customers and increase her sales so she makes more profits to sustain her family. One of her goals is to have a bigger store so she can give her customers better attention. With her previous loans, Reina's business has progressed a lot and her living conditions have improved. Reina has had 6 loans with FAMA and has paid them back on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Maria Del Consuelo

texts.es:
Sin contar con mucho capital Maria ha montado su propio negocio desde hace aproximadamente 7 años, cuando decidió generar sus propios ingresos y contar con un dinero para contribuir económicamente a los gastos de su hogar. Maria desde entonces viene ofreciendo prendas de vestir a través de catálogos, donde tiene clientes de todo el municipio y ha generado una gran reputación por la buena calidad de sus productos y la buena atención que ofrece. Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos a quienes gracias a su trabajo les puede brindar una buena calidad de vida y un estudio de buena calidad. En su negocio, ha podido tener muy buenas ventas y estas vienen aumentando considerablemente en los últimos meses, es por esto que Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir con las cuales pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y pueda responder a unos pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Maria espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y siga generando ingresos con los cuales les pueda aportar económicamente para su sostenimiento. Además, Maria sueña con poder tener un gran negocio en el cual pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y desde el cual pueda ofrecer una estabilidad económica y mayores oportunidades de progreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Maria has set up her own business for about 7 years when she decided to generate her own income to contribute financially to the household expenses. Maria has since been offering apparel through catalogs, where she has customers around tow.  She has gained a great reputation for high quality products and offering good service. Maria is married and has 3 children, for whom thanks to her work, she can provide a good quality of life and a good education. In her business, she may have had very good sales and they are increasing significantly in recent months, which is why Maria seeks a loan to give her the ability to buy clothing.   She can then offer a greater variety of products to her customers respond to some requests they have made.

Maria expects to continue growing her business and generating income with which she can contribute financially to sustain them. In addition, Maria dreams of having a great business from which she can create jobs for people in need provide greater economic stability and advancement opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers and respond to some of their requests.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia es madre soltera y tiene una hija bajo su responsabilidad, a quien le quiere dar lo mejor. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de médicos de una operación que necesita en el brazo izquierdo y comprar el medicamento que necesita para la recuperación, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir esta emergencia de salud que requiere. 
Doña Rosa Elia es empleada de una clínica, en el departamento de limpieza, es el ingreso que obtiene para los gastos familiares y escalares de su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia is a single mother with one daughter to care for; she wants to give her the best.

She is asking for a loan to pay for the cost of an operation that she needs on her left arm and to buy medicines for her recovery, because she doesn't have the money she needs to cover the cost of this health emergency.

Rosa Elia works at a clinic on the cleaning crew. Her income pays for the family's costs and her daughter's schooling.

loans.use: with medical costs.

loans.name: Hynoon

texts.en: Hynoon is married and a very responsible father who provides for the needs of his family. Hynoon is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy materials that he needs in his auto shop to better serve his clients. Hynoon dreams that someday he will give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to use for his auto shop.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen C. owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She is 55 years old, married and has nine grown-up children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo. Helen has been in her business for over 15 years and earns PHP 2,000 a month. In the future, Helen hopes that her business is expand to serve the need of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar es una persona que ha tenido que superar muchas adversidades en su vida, en lo cual sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante le han permitido luchar fuertemente contra estas dificultades y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Omar tiene a su cargo 4 hijos, pues su madre los dejó hace un tiempo, y además de esto, desde hace aproximadamente 5 años se quedó sin empleo y se vio en la obligación de buscar la manera de generar ingresos con los cuales pudiera sostener su hogar. Fue así como montó su propio negocio de venta de papas, plátanos fritos los cuales los prepara en un carro y se ubica a las afueras de un colegio durante todo el día. Con esta actividad ha podido generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de su hogar y con lo que ha podido brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que su residencia es bastante alejada del colegio donde ofrece sus productos, Omar le ha colocado un motor a su carro para poder transportarlo, sin embargo, en estos momentos su motor se encuentra averiado y no ha tenido los recursos económicos para arreglarlo. Es por esto que Omar busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a realizar la reparación del motor de su carro y poder transportarlo desde su residencia hasta el colegio donde ofrece sus productos.

Omar espera que así pueda seguir trabajando y seguir generando los ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y un estudio de calidad.
texts.en:
Omar is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in his life.  His desire to work and get ahead has allowed him to fight hard against these difficulties and continue making progress with his family.  Omar is responsible for his four children because their mother left them some time ago.  In addition to this, he has been without work for approximately five years and he saw the need to look for a way to generate income with which to support his household.

This was how he set up his own business selling potatoes and fried bananas, which he prepares in a cart and is located outside a school all day.  With this job he has been able to generate the income he needs to support his household and with which he has been able to give his children a better quality of life.

Because his residence is quite far from the school where he sells his products, Omar has put a motor in his cart to be able to transport it.  Nevertheless, right now his motor is broken and he has not had the financial resources to fix it.  For this reason Omar is looking for a loan that will give him the possibility of repairing the motor of his cart and be able to transport it from his residence to the school where he sells his products.

Omar hopes that he can continue working and generate the income with which he can give his children a good quality of life and a quality education.

loans.use: to repair the motor of his cart to be able to transport it from his home to the school where he sells his products.

loans.name: Norma Argentina

texts.es: Norma vive (suburbio Ecuador ). Ella comenzó hace mucho vendiendo artículos de bazar por el motivo de que su esposo la abandono y en ese tiempo sus hijos eran pequeños y no tenia como alimentarlos haci que decidió intalar el bazar. Su trabajo lo realiza por las tardes sola . es casada tiene hijos pero ya mayores . la dificultad que tiene es la inseguridad del sector. A futuro ella anhela poder incrementar el negocio. Con el préstamo comprara utiles escolares, papeleria, cuadernos, vitrinas.
texts.en:
Norma lives in Suburbio, Ecuador.  A long time ago she began selling stationery items because her husband abandoned her.  At that time her children were young and she had no way to feed them, so she decided to set up the stationery store.  She does her work in the afternoon, and she works alone.  She is married and has children who are older now.  The problem she has is the insecurity in the industry.  In the future she wants to expand her business.

With the loan she will buy school supplies, stationery, notebooks, and display cases.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, stationery, notebooks, and display cases.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Riziki Mpya, Femme veuve  dynamique, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 52 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de braises, bananes, etc. Son mari fut inopinément décédé suite à une courte maladie. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle fut mariée. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  11eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé de renouveler son cycle de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 sacs de braises, 4 régimes de bananes.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is a member of the RIZIKI MPYA group.  She is a dynamic 52-year-old widow and an experienced entrepreneur.  She sells embers, bananas etc..  Her husband passed away unexpectedly after a short illness.

She started her own business right after getting married.  Three years ago she learned that the micro-finance institution Hekima was providing micro-loans.  This is how she obtained her first loan of 50 USD, which allowed her to strengthen her business.  With the profits from her activity she is able to put some money into saving, to feed her children, and to provide for their education.

She has just obtained her eleventh loan.  During that time period, her business has grown positively.  This is why she has decided to request a new loan cycle.  This new loan will be used to buy five bags of embers and four bunches of bananas.  

She would also like to see her children grow comfortably.  She thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the empowerment of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy five bags of embers and four bunches of bananas.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr: Monsieur Richard,marié et âgé de 33 ans a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 8 ans le moins âgé a une année. 3 enfants vont à l'école, et a un autre enfant en charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 5 ans de l'école primaire. Il est devenu client de l'ACB en 2007, et est au 19ème cycle de crédit. Tous les crédits antérieurs sont remboursés sans aucun problème.  Le crédit lui octroyé est utilisé dans l'achat des matériaux de construction pour réhabiliter sa maison d'habitation. Après réhabiliter cette maison qui est divisée en deux parties, une partie sera mise en location. Ceci lui permettra d'avoir des revenus additionnels qui lui permetrra d'assurer davangate le bien être de sa famille. Dans le futur, il prévoit demander un crédit pour acheter une moto qui sera utilisée au transport remuneré des personnes. Son ambition pour sa famille est d'acheter une vache pour chacun de ses enfants, ce qui leur permettra d'avoir du lait à boire et à vendre et ça leur procurera les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
Richard, a 33 year old married man, has four children - the eldest is 8 years old, the youngest one. Three of the children attend school, and he also has another dependent child. He completed five years of primary education. He became a client of the ACB in 2007, and this will be his 19th loan with them. All the previous loans have been repaid without any problems. 
The current loan is to be used to purchase construction materials to remodel his home. After remodelling this house, which is divided into two sections, one half will be put up for rent.
This will enable him to earn additional income, which will better enable him to take care of his family. In the future, he intends to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used to take passengers on trips they will pay for.
His ambition for the family is to buy a cow for each of his children, which will allow them to have milk to drink and for sale, which will in turn pay for the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate his house (20 planks, 20 insulated gypsum boards, 3 doors, etc)

loans.name: Copaboka 3 Group

texts.fr:
Marie, cultivatrice du riz, fait partie du groupe COPABOKA 3. Ell est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et a 3 enfants dont le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. Ses deux enfants vont à l'école et aucune personne n'est en sa charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 6 ans de l'école primaire.

Elle a commencé de travailler avec ACB en 2012, et le cycle actuel est le premier pour elle. Avec le crédit lui octroyé, elle a acheté les angrais chimiques pour son riz et a payé la main d'oeuvre des gens qui ont preparé le champs. Pour accroître son agriculture, elle a une stratégie de demander autres crédit dans le futur, ceci lui permettra d'être très compétente dans le secteur d'agriculture du riz. Avec le profit, elle va assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie, a rice grower, belongs to the COPABOKA 3 group. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 22 and the youngest is 11. Two of her children go to school, and she has no other dependents. Marie attended school for 6 years at the primary level.

She first collaborated with ACB in 2012, and this is her first loan cycle. With the loan, she has purchased chemical fertilizers for her rice, and paid the workers who prepared the fields. To increase her crop, Marie plans to ask for more loans in the future, which will allow her to become skilled in the rice-growing sector. With the profit, she will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay the workers who have prepared her land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédite Esther, femme  dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur, veuve. Elle est  vendeuse des Boissons et autres articles divers (Omo,biscuits,sels,riz,etc.). Elle s’entraide avec  ses enfants  dans cette affaire. Elle a commencé son business de lors que son époux fut décédé vers les années 2000. Plus tard elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  9eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, bien que la crise financière semble menacée de tout bord, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  10 cassiers de boissons (Fanta, Primus, Coca).En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is a member of the ESTHER group.  She is a dynamic and ambitious widow with an entrepreneur spirit.  She sells drinks and other various items (Omo washing powder, crackers, salt, rice etc...).  Her children help her with her business, which she started after her husband passed away around the year 2000.

Later on, she learned that the micro-finance institution Hekima was granting micro-loans, and she received her first loan of 50 USD, which helped her strengthen her business.  With the profits from her business, she is able to put some money into savings, feed her children and pay for their school fees.  She has now received her ninth loan.  During that period of time, in spite of the looming financial crisis, she has seen her business thrive.  This is why she has decided to request a larger loan amount for this new cycle.  This new loan will help her to purchase 10 crates of drinks (Fanta, Primus, Coca Cola).

She would like to see her children grow.  She thanks Hekima for its action in favor of the empowerment of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to pay for ten crates of drinks (Fanta, Primus, Coca Cola).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe d’affaires Kavira groupe. Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 7 enfants parmi les quels deux enfants n’étudient plus faute de moyens financiers. Elle est  vendeuse des poissons. Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle a commencé son business avec  un micro crédit de 50$ reçu de l’IMF Hekima. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  6eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 paniers de poissons.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is a member of the Kavira group.  She is a dynamic 40 year-old entrepreneur and the mother of seven children.  Two of her children no longer attend school for lack of financial means.

She sells fish.  Her husband is involved in small retail business.  She started her business with a loan of 50 USD from the micro-finance institution Hekima.  The profits from her activity help her to put some money into savings, to feed her children and pay for their school fees.  

She has now received her sixth loan.  During that time period, she has seen her business thrive.  This is why she has decided to request a larger loan amount for this new cycle.  With this new loan, she will be able to purchase five baskets of fish.  She would also like to see her children grow, and to buy a house.

She thanks Hekima for its action in favor of the empowerment of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy five baskets of fish.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Glarice

texts.fr:
Glarice est une femme âgée de 22 ans. Elle est célibataire.
Glarice travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Glarice a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Glarice voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Glarice is a 22-year-old single woman who has been working as a reseller since 2011.  She sells charcoal from her home to customers from all walks of life.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her main difficulty is that she is out of stock.

Glarice has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Glarice would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Songum Tom Yingue Group

texts.fr:
Mr AUGUSTIN  est la représentante du groupe SONGUM TOM YINGUE. Il  est marié et père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Les 03  vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Il  est gérant de kiosque   depuis  06ans. Il s’approvisionne  avec les marchands. Ses clients sont  les  jeunes du quartier et les passagers.

Il veut améliorer le cadre de travail en  s’achetant 01 réfrigérateur, 03 tables et 12 chaises.

Il  utilise  ses bénéfices pour agrandir l’activité. Il ambitionne  construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Augustin is the representative of the the SONGUM TOM YINGUE group.  He is married and the father of four children.  His oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is 13.  Three of his children attend school.  He is financially responsible for 6 people.

Augustin has been working as a cafe manager for the past six years.  He gets his supplies from retailers.  His clients are young people and travelers.

Augustin would like to improve his workplace by purchasing one refrigerator, three tables and a dozen chairs.

He uses his profits to expand his business. His ambition is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy one refrigerator, three tables and a dozen chairs.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es: Juan Lorenzo es miembro del Grupo Solidario El Paraíso, tiene  43 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos de los cuales son estudiantes, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, el señor Juan se dedica a comercializar astillas de ocote, tiene el apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos que son los que le ayudan a desempeñar la labor en su microempresa, son una familia trabajadora y muy unida. Don Juan inicio desde hace dos años su negocio de elaboracion de astillas de ocote ya que le ha resultado  muy rentable, el trabajo lo realizan de 6:00 am a 5:30 pm. El préstamo que don Juan solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de trozos de madera para la elaboración de astillas de ocote. Con el apoyo de este préstamo don Juan podrá hacer crecer su negocio con el cual comprara la materia prima para la elaboración de su producto. Sus metas es que su negocio pueda estar en mejores condiciones, creando un mejor plantel para la elaboración de astillas de ocote y desea que sus hijos puedan llegar a ser profesionales. Tiene 4 ciclos de trabajar con los préstamos de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y los préstamos obtenidos le han ayudado a mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Lorenzo is a member of El Paraíso solidarity group.  He is 43 years old and married, with six children who are students.  His wife does domestic work.  Juan works selling kindling of ocote wood.  He has the help of his wife and his children, who are the ones who help him carry out the work in his micro-enterprise.  They are a hardworking and very close family.

Two years ago Juan started his business making ocote kindling, and it has turned out to be very profitable.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.

The loan Juan is requesting is to invest in buying pieces of wood to make ocote kindling.  With the help of the loan Juan will be able to make his business grow, with which he will buy the materials to make his product.

His goal is for his business to be in better condition, creating a better nursery to make ocote kindling.  Also, he wants for his children to be able to become professionals.

He has worked with FAMA loans for four cycles and he has made his payments punctually.  The loans have helped him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pieces of wood.

loans.name: Ramon Elias

texts.es:
Ramón es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido superar las grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Ramón se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de ingresar a una educación de calidad. Ramón es agricultor y desempeñó esta actividad durante gran parte de su vida, sin embargo, las pocas oportunidades a las que tenía acceso hicieron que abandonara esta actividad y decidió montar una tienda general donde ofrece toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar. Desde este negocio ha tenido la oportunidad de brindar a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso, y es por esto que quiere buscar la manera de que siga creciendo. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, Ramón busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Ramón espera que su negocio salga adelante y les siga brindando a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Además, Ramón sueña con poder tener su propio local donde ubicar su tienda y no tener que pagar los altos costos del arriendo por esta.
texts.en:
Ramón is a person who has always been very hard working and this has allowed him to rise above the big adversities that life has presented. Ramón is married and has 2 children, who are 4 and 7 years old. He has always wanted to offer them a good quality of life and better opportunities to get a quality education. Ramón is a farmer and he has been in this business for most of his life. However, the few opportunities that he had access to made him abandon that activity and he decided to open a general store where he offers all kind of basic products that families need. With this business he has been able to provide his children a good quality of life and better opportunities for progress. This is why he wants to find a way to keep growing. With an eye to stocking his business, Ramón is looking for a loan to will provide him the opportunity to buy basic products for the family so that he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

Ramón hopes his business will come out ahead and continue providing his children with a better quality of life and more opportunities for making progress. Ramón also dreams of having his own place to locate his store and not having to pay the high cost of rent.

loans.use: to buy basic products for the family so that he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio de 38 años de edad convive con modesta de 42 años fruto de  esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la asociación de vista alegre en el distrito de Sivia. Eusebio es un hombre perseverante y solidario, él se dedica al cultivo de cacao, asimismo compra productos agrícolas como cacao, café y achiote desde hace 5 años. Cuenta que todo le va muy bien en su trabajo, el único inconveniente que tiene es no contar con movilidad propia, por lo que esto hace que el costo del flete sea muy elevado. En temporadas de producción se dedica al acopio de productos, mientras que su querida esposa es la encargada en hacer trabajar su parcela agrícola con personales que contrata por temporada para así obtener mejores cosechas. Eusebio está contento con esta labor que realiza por que le deja una buena ganancia, pero aun no está tan contento con ello por lo que esta pensando en abrir un restaurante, porque tiene una vivienda cerca del lugar donde desea montarlo. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que él una ves más se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Él esta contento con su banco comunal, por que son buenas personas. Con los 2, 500 realizará el mantenimiento de su parcela agrícola, contratará peines para sacar la maleza de entre sus plantas.
texts.en: Eusebio is 38 years old. He lives with Modesta, who is 42 years old, and with whom he has 3 children. They live together in their own house, located in the neighborhood of Vista Alegre, in the district of Sivia. Eusebio is a perseverant and supportive man. He farms cacao and also has also been buying products such as cacao, coffee, and annatto for the past 5 years. He tells us that everything is going very well in his work. The only difficulty he has is not having his own transportation, which makes the cost of shipping his products very high. During production seasons he mainly works at gathering up products, while his beloved wife is in charge of working their agricultural land with workers that they hire for the season so that they can have a better harvest. Eusebio is happy with the job he does because it gives him good earnings. At the same time, he is not content with it because he is planning to open a restaurant because he has a house near the place where he wants to open it. This is the fourth loan he has had with Microfinanzas Prisma. He pledges, once more, to make his repayments punctually. He is happy with his communal bank because they [the other members] are good people. With the 2,500 PEN he will do maintenance on his agricultural land. He will hire workers to weed in between the plants.

loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Tugirubukire B / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Wellars, membre du groupe TUGIRUBUKIRE B / Rbv, marié et âgé de 27 ans est agriculteur des pommes de terre. Il a un enfant qui a une année. Il n'a pas d'autres personnes en charge et son niveau d'éducation est 2 ans de l'école secondaire.
Il est devenu client d'ACB en 2011, il est au deuxième cycle de crédit. Le crédit qu'il a reçu lui a permit de faire préparer le champs, acheter les intrats ainsi que les angrais chimiques. Pour lui, aucune difficulté qui peut faire que ce crédit soit mal remboursé. Pour accroître son agriculture, Monsieur Wellars va solliciter d'autre crédit pour acheter d'autres champs. Une fois la superficie sera augmentée, ça lui permettra d'atteindre sa vision d'être le premier agriculteur des pommes de terre dans la région. Il va construire la maison pour sa famille. A part de cultiver les pommes de terre, activité financée, Monsieur Wellars fait l'élévage des vaches.
texts.en:
Wellars is a member of the TUGIRUBUKIRE B / Rbv group.  He is 27 years old, married, and works as a potato farmer.  Besides a one-year-old child, he has no other dependent.  He left school after the second year of secondary school.

Wellars became a client of ACB in 2011.  This is his second loan cycle.  With this new loan, he is preparing his field for cultivation, buying agricultural inputs and chemical fertilizers.  He foresees no difficulty in repaying this loan.  

In order to expand his farming business, Wellars is planning to apply for more loans in order to buy additional fields.  With more arable land, he will be able to realize his vision to become the first potato farmer in his region.  He will also build a house for his family.  

Besides potato farming, for which he receives financing, Wellars also raises cows.

loans.use: to buy 300 kg of potaoes, 150 kg of chemical fertilizers, 20 liters of water etc.

loans.name: Aleyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aleyda es originaria de Granada, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. Ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de fritangas, frescos y productos Avon desde hace un  año y medio, su actividad la inicio con la venta de productos de cosméticos Avon después con apoyo de instituciones financieras logro poner su pulpería debido a la  necesidad que ella vio en la gran demanda que tenían los productos básicos en su comunidad. Comercializa sus productos básicos en la casa y los productos Avon salen a ofrecerlos al barrio con el apoyo de una hija, es el único negocio que tiene pues no cuenta con otros ingresos. Su expectativa de  su negocio es   lograr hacerlo muy sostenible hasta no necesitar depender de los créditos.
 Realiza el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  plátano, carne, repollo, una mesa de plásticos, cosmeticos y otros productos que son necesarios para mejorar y surtir su negocio. Este crédito la ayudara porque podrá adquirir más materia prima para trabajar. Teniendo como planes futuros crecer en su negocio para poder darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos con estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Aleyda is from Granada. She has 3 children who live with her. She is a merchant who has been selling fried foods, soft drinks, and Avon cosmetic products for a year and a half. She began her business selling the Avon cosmetic products. Later, with the help of financial institutions, she opened her small grocery store because of the need she saw in the great demand for basic products in her community. She sells basic products from her home and she goes out into the neighborhood to sell the Avon products with the help of one of her daughters. This is the only business she has and she doesn’t have other sources of income. She is getting the loan to buy plantains, meat, cabbage, a plastic table, cosmetics, and other products that are necessary to for stocking her business. This loan will help her because she will buy more raw materials for her work. Her plans for the future are to grow her business so she can provide a better quality of life to her children through university studies.

loans.use: to buy plantains, meat, cabbage, a plastic table, and cosmetics

loans.name: Viviana Epifania

texts.es: Viviana de 26 años vive ( isla Guayaquil ). Ella decidió entrar a  este negocio hace 2 años tenia una capital y decidió co mprar una tricimoto y desde ese entonces se dedica a esa actividad. Trabaja todos los días sola es madre soltera su esposo la abandono tiene 3 hijos . a futuro anhela tener su propia empresa de tricimotos . con el préstamo comprara ( materiales de vivienda ) asi comprar cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Viviana, 26, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  She decided to get into this business two years ago.  She had capital and she decided to buy a three-wheeled motorcycle, and since then she has worked in this job.  She works every day alone.  She is a single mother of three children.  Her husband abandoned her.  In the future she wants to have her own three-wheeled motorcycle business.

With the loan she will buy housing materials: cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es: Gladys de 52 años vive ( manta Ecuador ). Ella comenzó hace mucho vendiendo artículos de bazar pero al ver que las ventas fueron disminuyendo decidió hacer bocaditos la cual a sido un buen negocio. Su trabajo lo realiza por las tardes sola . es casada tiene hijos pero ya mayores . la dificultad que tiene es la inseguridad del sector. A futuro ella anhela poder incrementar el negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (vitrina y materiales de cocina ).
texts.en: Gladys is 52 years old. She lives in Manta, Ecuador. She began selling stationary products a long time ago, but when she saw that sales were going down, she decided to make snacks, which has been a good business. She works in the afternoons, by herself. She is married and has children, but they are grown. The difficulty she has is the lack of security in the neighborhood. She wishes very much to grow her business in the future. With the loan she will buy a vitrine and cooking ingredients.

loans.use: a vitrine.

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es: Angel de 39 años vive ( duran Ecuador  ). El decidió entrar a esta negocio por que ya sabia como era porque desde pequeño le ayudaba a su padre. Con el tiempo el decidió aumentar mercadseria y vender el . trabaja todos los días y lo ayuda su padre . a futuro el anhela tener su negocio grande . con el préstamo comprara ( verduras ).
texts.en: Angel is 39 years old. He lives in Duran, Ecuador. He decided to get into this business because he already knew what it was like because from the time he was very young he helped his father. Over time he decided to increase his merchandise and sell for himself. He works every day and he helps his father. For the future he wishes to have a large business. With the loan he will buy vegetables.

loans.use: vegetables

loans.name: Tusigaigoa

texts.en:
Tusigaigoa is 35 years of age and single. She owns and operates a business venture, selling barbeque. She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Tusigaigoa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, plastic plates, foil, soy sauce, and tomato sauce. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Tusigaigoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tusigaigoa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Nazima's Group

texts.en:
Nazima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her plastic items manufacturing business. She makes plastic utensils and other items which sells for a good price in the market.  With the loan investment, Nazima will buy plastic beans in large quantity that will allow her to fulfill larger orders on time.

Nazima is the mother of 5 children. Her eldest son is illiterate while the others are continuing their education.  Her husband is involved in an artificial jewelry selling business.  He is a well-known jeweler in his area and has a good client base.  She is very confident that her business will be improved with the loan investment and it will help her family to live a better life.

Note: "One of the members has clothes sales business thats why they are holding clothes".

loans.use: To buy plasic beans to make plastic items

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en:
Tepora is 56 years old and married with six children. She is starting a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.    

Tepora needs a loan of 3000 WST to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated at 400 WST, or 167 USD, per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Tepora joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tepora's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 21 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the town of Falealupo Uta.  To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Filomena has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2012, Filomena re-joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Filomena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD in 'Upolu, the main island.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  Filomena is now requesting a new loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase a box of chicken, sausage, plastic plates, and foil.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD's branch office in Savai'i, where she now lives.  Filomena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: to purchase box of chicken, sausage, plastic plates, and foil.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and three children (one daughter and two sons) in the rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. All of her children are students who are still strongly dependent on her.  

San earns a living through farming rice on her own one-hectare farmland. She has been in business for seven years and she currently earns about $3 per day. This is San's first loan with Kiva field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of three female members and she is the leader of the group. She is now requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR while her group members are requesting loans of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. 

She hopes to earn more income and be able to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Neam's Group

texts.en:
Neam, aged 35, is a mother of three children. She lives with her husband and her three children in the rural village of the Tbaaung Khmum district. She and her husband are rice farmers while her three children (two daughters and one son) are still students.

To overcome her family's hardship to support her family, Neam and her husband have been farming rice on her own farmland for about 8 years. Having been with VisionFund for two cycles, Neam has managed to improve her living condition and buy additional plot of farmland. With her current business, she can earn up to US$3 per day and she is able to save about US$1 each day for the future needs. 

Assuredly with the satisfactory result of the previous loans, Neam leads a group of two members including herself to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 Khmer Riels and the other member is requesting 1,200,000 KHR loan. As the group leader, Neam will use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farming. She hopes to increase her crop yields so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farming and plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 8 años de casada con Oscar, su esposo. Con quien tiene 7 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Lourdes es una mujer trabajador, ella junto a su esposo se dedica a la siembra de productos naturales como papa, alverja y habas. Esto le permitió obtener todo lo que hoy posee, como también ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante por eso, hace poco compró 2 motocarros con los que sus hijos trabajan en el trasporte público y de esa manera ayudan en la economía del hogar. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia en la agricultura, por ello se siente muy satisfecha de poder desarrollar su trabajo, sobre todo por que los comerciantes ya la conocen y respetan mucho. Ahora está un poco delicada de salud, pero continua trabajando para salir adelante, pero sin descuidar su salud, ya que necesita estar fuerte para sacara a su hijos adelante. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy satisfecha de poder, desarrollar sus actividades con normalidad, pues tiene el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete cargar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que siempre fue una persona trabajadora y honrada. Lurdes de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la reparación de su motocarro, de esa manera podrá trabajar con mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 41, is a hard-working woman who has been married to her husband, Oscar, for eight years.  They have seven children who they care for in their own home in the town of Pampas.  Lourdes and her husband work hard growing natural products such as potatoes, peas and lima beans.  This has allowed them to obtain everything they have today, including helping their children get ahead.  Just a short time ago Lourdes bought two motorcycles for her children to work in public transportation so they can help with the household economy.  She has much experience in agriculture and is very content to have the business she has, especially since the merchants know and respect her.

Nowadays her health is not so good, but she still works to get ahead, while taking care of herself since she needs to be strong to care for her children.  This is her third loan through MFP, which helps her carry out her activities normally through your support.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time since she has always been a hard worker and honest.  Lourdes plans to ue the loan to repair her vehicle so she can work with more peace of mind.

loans.use: To get her vehicle repaired.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 54 años es una mujer líder. Ella vive en compañía de Walter, su esposo desde hace 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mabel y José a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Es tesorera de su asociación, pues siempre gusto de administrar el dinero. Gracias a ello ahora tiene una ferretería, equipada y surtida. Según cuenta le va muy bien en su negocio; pues abre sus puertas todos los días sin descanso. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, no solo se dedica a ello. También vende comida los domingos, en un espacio de su casa. También su esposo se dedica al alquiler de maquinarias pesadas a instituciones del estado y constructoras privadas, las que le brindan un pago mensual, con ello paga los estudios universitarios de sus hijos; a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Ahora quieren ampliar su negocio de venta de cerveza al por mayor, pues hace poco incursionaron en ese negocio y quieren expandirlo, porque tiene muchas demanda y en estos meses le fue muy bien. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es crédito número veintiséis con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Yolanda de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería para sus negocios, entre cerveza y materiales para su ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 54, is a born leader.  She lives with Walter, her husband of 28 years, and they have two children, Mabel and José, who they care for in their own house in the city of Chilca.  She is the treasurer of her association and has always enjoyed managing money.  Thanks to this, now she has a hardware store that is well stocked.  She says business is going well, since she opens every day of the week.  And since she his a hard worker, that's not all she does; she also sells food on Sunday from home.  Her husband rents heavy equipment to state institutions and private constructors, and earns a monthly salary which pay for their children's university studies, so they can receive a good education.  

Now she wants to expand her business and sell beer wholesale.  They started selling beer not too long ago and now want to expand the business because demand is high and they have done well in the past few months.  She belongs to the communal bank "IDME" and this is her 26th loan through MFP.  She is counting on your support so she can continue toward her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and is grateful to the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and caring.

Yolanda plans to use the loan to buy merchandise for her businesses, i.e. beer and hardware merchandise.

loans.use: To buy materials for her hardware store and cases of beer.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un  soudeur.  Elle a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 09 ans.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2002. Elle vend seule à toute personne dans sa boutique et achète les produits à Lomé. 
Afi a requis son cinquième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle veut diversifier les produits.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait être grossiste. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de quitter la location pour leur propre maison.
texts.en:
Afi is 36 years old and is married to a welder. She has 2 children, aged 12 and 9, who both attend school.

Afi has been selling grocery products since 2002. She works alone and sells the products in her shop to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé.

Afi has requested her 5th loan from WAGES in order to buy more products so that she can better respond to customer demand. She would like to diversify her range of products.

In the coming years, Afi would like to become a wholesaler. She plans to use her profits to leave her rental property and buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella, de 52 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Wilfredo y Yamileth, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. Afronta muchos problemas; uno de ellos son los problemas con su esposo, del que se encuentra separado. A pesar de ello continúa trabajando, pues tiene que velar por sus hijos. Su actividad económica por 20 años, es la venta de carne. Cuenta que su trabajo consiste en la compra de ganado porcino en cantidad, sobre todo a los más gorditos y sanos, los que mata para vender la carne en ferias regionales y de los distritos. Con ellos obtiene buenas ganancias, además aprovecha el puesto que tiene para vender productos de belleza a los clientes que ya la conocen. Le va muy bien en su negocio, “vendo más cantidad de carne en las festividades”, afirma. Hace poco izo realidad su proyecto y ahora vende chicharrones (lugar donde se vende platos a base de carne de cerdo), en un restaurante que abre los fines de semana, donde está obteniendo ganancias extras que piensa invertir en el mejoramiento de su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este el crédito número veinticinco con  MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Estrella de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales para su negocio.
texts.en: Estrella, 52, is a simple woman who lives with her two children, Wilfredo and Yamileth, who she cares for in their own home in the district of Chilca.  She is up against many problems, especially problems with her husband from whom she is divorced.  But she continues to work because she must look out for her children.  She has been in business 20 years selling meat.  She says her work consists of buying a number of pigs that she fattens and slaughters to sell at the regional fairs in the districts.  She earns a good profit and also uses her stall to sell beauty products to the customers that know her.  Business is doing well, "I sell more meat during the holidays", she states.  Not too long ago she started selling pork cracklings at a restaurant that opens on weekends.  This is to earn extra money to invest in improvements for her business.  She belongs to the communal bank "IDME" anf this is her 25th loan through MFP, where she is counting on you for support to continue toward her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and enjoys belonging to her communal bank because all the members are responsible and caring.  Estrella plans to use the loan to buy livestock for her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock for her business.

loans.name: Esso-Hawè

texts.fr:
Esso-Hawé est une femme âgée de 49	 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de sécurité. Elle a 5 enfants, dont 4 à l’école. Le premier a 26 ans et le dernier a 11 ans.
Esso-Hawè travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1987. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Esso-Hawè a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Esso-Hawè voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et faire également le commerce du bois de chauffe et des céréales. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Esso-Hawé is 49 years old. She is married to a security officer. She has 5 children, 4 of whom go to school. The eldest child is 26 years old, and the youngest 11.

Esso-Hawé has been working as a reseller since 1987. She sells charcoal door-to-door to all sorts of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her main difficulty is her insufficient inventory.

Esso-Hawé has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal. She would like to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Esso-Hawé would like to expand her business and diversify into selling cereals. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family's food needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Afi Christine

texts.fr:
Christine est une femme  âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.
Christine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des céréales et du bois de chauffe pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Christine a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et du bois de chauffe. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Christine voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old. She is married to a driver and has no children.

Christine has been working as a reseller since 2000. She sells cereals and firewood door-to-door, to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Right now, her main difficulty is her inability to satisfy all of her customers' demands.

Christine has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and firewood. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Christine would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals and firewood.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme âgée de 62 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 4 enfants. Le premier a 35 ans et le dernier a 27 ans.
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Ayoko a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayoko voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayoko is 62 years old and married to a pensioner. She has 4 children, the eldest of whom is 35 years old, and the youngest 27.

Ayoko has been working as a reseller since 2000. She sells beauty products door-to-door to all types of customers. She gets the products in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her principal difficulty is her lack of sufficient inventory.

Ayoko has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products. She would like to reinvest in her business.

Ayoko would like to expand her business in the years ahead. She plans to use her profits to make sure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Awtar Group

texts.en:
This group is called “AWTAR”. It is made up of five members: Awtar, Safa, Abeer, Nagla and Mriam, who work together in different areas. Among these are selling ladies' clothes. This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays.  They requested a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Awtar is 28 years old, a married woman with two children. She is the leader of this group. (In the photo she is on the left, with pink fabric on her shoulder.) She lives in Aden, Yemen. She is a merchant; specifically she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. 

Awtar has been doing this for three years. She sells her products from her house. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothes market in her neighborhood.

She is very grateful to her neighbors who supported her over all these years. With the income from her business she was able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comfort. At the present time, her business doesn't get her as much profit due to the bad situation in Yemen.

 So she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. She will sell them to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business. One of her personal dreams is to send her children to  private  high schools.

loans.use: to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik, 24 years old, is a married man but he doesn`t have any children. He and his wife live together in Ibb, Yemen. He is a tailor who has owned his business for two years. The business allows him to support his family, so he has sole responsibility for them now.

Malik was a worker in his friend`s sewing business before, but he eventually saved enough money to open his own store. He tells us that he is very happy with the business now. 

He wants to expand by adding a wider range of ladies' fabrics so he is applying for a youth loan of 150,000 YER to buy more products such as cloaks (Arabian "Abaya") and he's sure the investment will increase his sales so he can sew because there is a lot of demand for these products in the market. 

Malik would like to have a larger store one day so that he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy more products such as cloaks (Arabian "Abaya")  for his business.
